definition[0]: to find someone or something, either by accident or because you were looking for them
example[0]: The body was discovered in a field.
example[1]: Forest Service crews often discover campfires that have not been put out completely.
definition[1]: to find out something that you did not know about before
example[2]: The exercises let students discover math concepts on their own.
example[3]: She discovered that she was pregnant.
example[4]: His friends were shocked to discover how ill he was.
explanation[0]: In more formal English, you say it is discovered that something is true
example[5]: It was discovered that lightning was electrical
definition[2]: if someone discovers a new place, fact, substance etc, they are the first person to find it or know that it exists
example[6]: The Curies are best known for discovering radium.
definition[3]: to notice or try something for the first time and start to enjoy it
definition[4]: to notice someone who is very good at something and help them to become successful and well known
example[8]: a band thatâ€™s waiting to be discovered
